engineering_design_principles.mechanism: Gravitational forces and material composition result in spherical shape, which maximizes surface area for a given volume and allows for better detection and study.

engineering_design_principles.description: Use of mathematical equations to describe motion
engineering_design_principles.mechanism: Orbits of celestial bodies can be described using mathematical equations, allowing for prediction and analysis of motion.
Orbits of celestial bodies often intersect with other debris, demonstrating the dynamic and ever-changing nature of celestial systems.

engineering_design_principles.description: Geometric and mathematical principles in planet definition
engineering_design_principles.mechanism: Despite not having cleared their orbits, celestial bodies can still meet many of the same geometric, mathematical, and engineering principles that define other planets.
